definition: lit. to celebrate peace with songs and dance (idiom)/fig. to make a show of happiness and prosperity
song/CL:支[zhi1],首[shou3]/to sing
variant of 歌[ge1]
to dance/to wield/to brandish
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: A merry scene at Phnom Penh's night.
sentences.chinese: 金边的夜晚一片歌舞升平的景象。

sentences.english: Put to fly the white pigeon, the song and dance peace and prosperity, pursue peaceful that kind of atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 放飞白鸽，歌舞升平，追求和平的那种气氛。
旖旎人生路，歌舞升平心。

definition: peace and prosperity (idiom)
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
the warbler sings and the swallow dances/prosperity abounds (idiom)
as if drunk or entranced (idiom); leading a befuddled existence/in a drunken stupor
lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
wine goblets and gambling chips lie intertwined/to drink and gamble together in a large group (idiom)/a big (drinking) party
flourishing/bustling
extravagant
music and song (formal writing)
a flourishing period/period of prosperity/a golden age
young people decked out in gorgeous clothes (idiom)
singing and dancing
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
